com.yworks.yfiles.view.input

Class MoveViewportInputMode

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yworks.yfiles.view.input.MoveViewportInputMode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IInputMode

    public class MoveViewportInputMode
extends Object
implements IInputMode
    An IInputMode implementation that can be used to grab and drag the viewport of the control it is installed in.

    This implementation will request the mutex as soon as it recognizes a drag with the mouse or touch. Zooming is done with two fingers using the pinch zoom gesture. If the primary pointer is released during pinch, the secondary pointer is used for viewpoint dragging. The pinch zoom then can be restarted by touching another pointer that is recognized as the primary pointer.

    This mode is Exclusive by default.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MoveViewportInputMode()
      Creates a new instance of the move viewport mode.

      • getInertiaDamping

        public final double getInertiaDamping()
        The amount of damping that is applied to the inertia movement.

        The default value is 0.15d

        Returns:
        A value between 0 and 1 that determines the factor the inertia speed is reduced by after one second.
        See Also:
        setInertiaDamping(double)

      • getInertiaFactor

        public final double getInertiaFactor()
        Gets the factor that determines how much the recent movement data is taken into account for the calculation of inertia speed and direction.

        The default value is 0.02d

        Returns:
        A value between 0 and 1. Lesser values mean less influence of old data.
        See Also:
        setInertiaFactor(double)

      • getInertiaThreshold

        public final double getInertiaThreshold()
        Gets the threshold that determines when inertia movement should stop.

        The default value is 30

        Returns:
        A positive value that determines the threshold in pixels per second.
        See Also:
        setInertiaThreshold(double)

      • getInputModeContext

        public final IInputModeContext getInputModeContext()
        Description copied from interface: IInputMode
        Returns the context instance this mode is currently installed in or null if this instance is not installed.

        Note that this instance should not be passed down to subordinate modes or instances. Instead a corresponding context that has this instance set as the ParentInputMode should be used.

        Specified by:
        getInputModeContext in interface IInputMode
        Returns:
        The InputModeContext.

        Returns:
        The "pressed" recognizer.
        See Also:

      • getPrimaryDownRecognizer

        public final IEventRecognizer getPrimaryDownRecognizer()
        Gets the IEventRecognizer that starts the 'move viewport' gesture.
        Returns:
        The recognizer instance that identifies the event that starts the viewport moving gesture. The default instance recognizes if the user presses the primary touch device down.
        See Also:
        setPrimaryDownRecognizer(IEventRecognizer)

      • getPrimaryMoveRecognizer

        public final IEventRecognizer getPrimaryMoveRecognizer()
        Gets the IEventRecognizer that moves the viewport or zooms the canvas if a secondary device is down.
        Returns:
        The recognizer instance that identifies the event that moves the viewport or zooms the canvas. The default instance recognizes if the user moves the primary touch device.
        See Also:
        setPrimaryMoveRecognizer(IEventRecognizer)

      • getPrimaryUpRecognizer

        public final IEventRecognizer getPrimaryUpRecognizer()
        Gets the IEventRecognizer that ends the 'move viewport' or 'pinch' gesture.
        Returns:
        The recognizer instance that identifies the event that ends the viewport moving or pinch gesture. The default instance recognizes if the user releases the primary touch device.
        See Also:
        setPrimaryUpRecognizer(IEventRecognizer)

      • getPriority

        public final int getPriority()
        Description copied from interface: IInputMode
        The priority of this input mode.

        The priority will influence the order in which the modes will be installed into the canvas control. The lower the priority value, the earlier it will be installed. If two modes are installed using the same priority value, the first one will be installed earlier.

        Specified by:
        getPriority in interface IInputMode
        Returns:
        The Priority.

      • getReleasedRecognizer

        public final IEventRecognizer getReleasedRecognizer()
        Gets the "released" recognizer.

        This instance determines when the user has finished dragging the viewport.

        Returns:
        The "released" recognizer.
        See Also:
        setReleasedRecognizer(IEventRecognizer)

      • getSecondaryDownRecognizer

        public final IEventRecognizer getSecondaryDownRecognizer()
        Gets the IEventRecognizer that starts the 'pinch' gesture.
        Returns:
        The recognizer instance that identifies the event that starts the pinch gesture. The default instance recognizes if the user presses the secondary touch device down.
        See Also:
        setSecondaryDownRecognizer(IEventRecognizer)

      • getSecondaryMoveRecognizer

        public final IEventRecognizer getSecondaryMoveRecognizer()
        Gets the IEventRecognizer that zooms the canvas using the 'pinch' gesture or moves the viewport if no primary device is down.
        Returns:
        The recognizer instance that identifies the event that zooms the canvas or moves the viewport if no primary device is down. The default instance recognizes if the user moves the secondary touch device.
        See Also:
        setSecondaryMoveRecognizer(IEventRecognizer)

      • getSecondaryUpRecognizer

        public final IEventRecognizer getSecondaryUpRecognizer()
        Gets the IEventRecognizer that ends the pinch zoom gesture or ends the move if no primary device is down.
        Returns:
        The recognizer instance that identifies the event that ends the pinch zoom gesture or ends the move if no primary device is down. The default instance recognizes if the user releases the secondary touch device.
        See Also:
        setSecondaryUpRecognizer(IEventRecognizer)

      • install

        public void install(IInputModeContext context,
                    ConcurrencyController controller)
        Installs this mode into the given context that is provided by the canvas.

        In general a mode can only be installed into a single canvas at all times.

        This method is called to initialize this instance. Subclasses should override this method to register the corresponding event handler delegates for the various input events they need to register with.

        Overriding implementations should call the base implementation, first.

        Specified by:
        install in interface IInputMode
        Parameters:
        context - The context that this instance shall be installed into. The same instance will be passed to this instance during IInputMode.uninstall(IInputModeContext). A reference to the context may be kept and queried during the time the mode is installed.
        controller - The Controller for this mode.
        See Also:
        IInputMode.uninstall(IInputModeContext)

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Gets the enabled state of this input mode.

        Clients can use this property to disable or reenable this instance. This will set the Enabled property of the installed Controller so a disabled instance should never try to acquire the input mutex.

        Returns:
        The Enabled.
        See Also:
        setEnabled(boolean)

      • isExclusive

        public final boolean isExclusive()
        Gets a value indicating whether this mode will be the only one running when it has the mutex.

        The value of this property will be delegated to the Exclusive property of the Controller.

        If this mode is marked as exclusive and has the mutex, all other modes added to the same MultiplexingInputMode will be deactivated. Otherwise it will always run concurrently with all other modes.

        Returns:
        The Exclusive.
        See Also:
        setExclusive(boolean)

      • isPinchZoomAllowed

        public final boolean isPinchZoomAllowed()
        Gets a value indicating whether to allow the pinch zoom gesture.
        Returns:
        true if the pinch zoom gesture is allowed to change the zoom level; otherwise, false.
        See Also:
        setPinchZoomAllowed(boolean)

      • onCanceled

        protected void onCanceled()
        Called after cancel() has been called.

        Can be overridden in subclasses to perform additional actions after the mode has been canceled.

        This implementation does nothing.

      • onConcurrencyControllerActivated

        protected void onConcurrencyControllerActivated()
        Called after the Active property of the installed ConcurrencyController has been set to true.

        Can be overridden in subclasses to perform additional actions after the mode has been activated.

        Overriding implementations should call the base implementation.

      • onConcurrencyControllerDeactivated

        protected void onConcurrencyControllerDeactivated()
        Called after the Active property of the installed ConcurrencyController has been set to false.

        Can be overridden in subclasses to perform additional actions after the mode has been deactivated.

        Overriding implementations should call the base implementation.

      • setInertiaDamping

        public final void setInertiaDamping(double value)
        The amount of damping that is applied to the inertia movement.

        The default value is 0.15d

        Parameters:
        value - A value between 0 and 1 that determines the factor the inertia speed is reduced by after one second.
        See Also:
        getInertiaDamping()

      • setInertiaFactor

        public final void setInertiaFactor(double value)
        Sets the factor that determines how much the recent movement data is taken into account for the calculation of inertia speed and direction.

        The default value is 0.02d

        Parameters:
        value - A value between 0 and 1. Lesser values mean less influence of old data.
        See Also:
        getInertiaFactor()

      • setInertiaThreshold

        public final void setInertiaThreshold(double value)
        Sets the threshold that determines when inertia movement should stop.

        The default value is 30

        Parameters:
        value - A positive value that determines the threshold in pixels per second.
        See Also:
        getInertiaThreshold()

      • setPinchZoomAllowed

        public final void setPinchZoomAllowed(boolean value)
        Sets a value indicating whether to allow the pinch zoom gesture.
        Parameters:
        value - true if the pinch zoom gesture is allowed to change the zoom level; otherwise, false.
        See Also:
        isPinchZoomAllowed()

      • setPressedRecognizer

        public final void setPressedRecognizer(IEventRecognizer value)
        Sets the "pressed" state recognizer.

        This recognizer instance will be used to determine when the user begins the navigation gesture.

        Parameters:
        value - The "pressed" recognizer.
        See Also:
        getPressedRecognizer()

      • setPrimaryDownRecognizer

        public final void setPrimaryDownRecognizer(IEventRecognizer value)
        Sets the IEventRecognizer that starts the 'move viewport' gesture.
        Parameters:
        value - The recognizer instance that identifies the event that starts the viewport moving gesture. The default instance recognizes if the user presses the primary touch device down.
        See Also:
        getPrimaryDownRecognizer()

      • setPrimaryMoveRecognizer

        public final void setPrimaryMoveRecognizer(IEventRecognizer value)
        Sets the IEventRecognizer that moves the viewport or zooms the canvas if a secondary device is down.
        Parameters:
        value - The recognizer instance that identifies the event that moves the viewport or zooms the canvas. The default instance recognizes if the user moves the primary touch device.
        See Also:
        getPrimaryMoveRecognizer()

      • setPrimaryUpRecognizer

        public final void setPrimaryUpRecognizer(IEventRecognizer value)
        Sets the IEventRecognizer that ends the 'move viewport' or 'pinch' gesture.
        Parameters:
        value - The recognizer instance that identifies the event that ends the viewport moving or pinch gesture. The default instance recognizes if the user releases the primary touch device.
        See Also:
        getPrimaryUpRecognizer()

      • setPriority

        public final void setPriority(int value)
        The priority of this input mode.

        The priority will influence the order in which the modes will be installed into the canvas control. The lower the priority value, the earlier it will be installed. If two modes are installed using the same priority value, the first one will be installed earlier.

        Parameters:
        value - The Priority to set.
        See Also:
        getPriority()

      • setReleasedRecognizer

        public final void setReleasedRecognizer(IEventRecognizer value)
        Sets the "released" recognizer.

        This instance determines when the user has finished dragging the viewport.

        Parameters:
        value - The "released" recognizer.
        See Also:
        getReleasedRecognizer()

      • setSecondaryDownRecognizer

        public final void setSecondaryDownRecognizer(IEventRecognizer value)
        Sets the IEventRecognizer that starts the 'pinch' gesture.
        Parameters:
        value - The recognizer instance that identifies the event that starts the pinch gesture. The default instance recognizes if the user presses the secondary touch device down.
        See Also:
        getSecondaryDownRecognizer()

      • setSecondaryMoveRecognizer

        public final void setSecondaryMoveRecognizer(IEventRecognizer value)
        Sets the IEventRecognizer that zooms the canvas using the 'pinch' gesture or moves the viewport if no primary device is down.
        Parameters:
        value - The recognizer instance that identifies the event that zooms the canvas or moves the viewport if no primary device is down. The default instance recognizes if the user moves the secondary touch device.
        See Also:
        getSecondaryMoveRecognizer()

      • setSecondaryUpRecognizer

        public final void setSecondaryUpRecognizer(IEventRecognizer value)
        Sets the IEventRecognizer that ends the pinch zoom gesture or ends the move if no primary device is down.
        Parameters:
        value - The recognizer instance that identifies the event that ends the pinch zoom gesture or ends the move if no primary device is down. The default instance recognizes if the user releases the secondary touch device.
        See Also:
        getSecondaryUpRecognizer()

      • stop

        public boolean stop()
        Description copied from interface: IInputMode
        Called by the client in order to stop a current editing progress.

        This should stop the current edit, if one is in progress and possibly commit all of the changes. If stopping is not possible, this method can return false

        Specified by:
        stop in interface IInputMode
        Returns:
        true if and only if the editing has been stopped or there was no edit in progress
        See Also:
        IInputMode.cancel()

      • uninstall

        public final void uninstall(IInputModeContext context)
        Description copied from interface: IInputMode
        Uninstalls this mode from the given context.

        This code should clean up all changes made to the canvas in the IInputMode.install(IInputModeContext, ConcurrencyController) method. After a mode has been uninstalled it can be installed again into the same or another canvas.

        Specified by:
        uninstall in interface IInputMode
        Parameters:
        context - The context to deregister from. This is the same instance that had been passed to IInputMode.install(IInputModeContext, ConcurrencyController) during installation.
